intro: Pittosporum linearifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pittosporum, is a shrub or small tree native to New Zealand. It features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white or silver powdery coating. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are typically followed by bright red berries. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and landscapes around the world.
